args: Please note that this story contains spoilers for\nChapter 15 of the main campaign, the Fractured\nFutures event, and Audric's adventurer story.
We recommend reading the aforementioned events\nfirst for maximum enjoyment.
And I am the true seventh scion—\nhe who was replaced BY you.
What is the meaning of this?!
It's exactly like I explained it. Little\n{player_name} is not the late\nKing Aurelius's son.
The true seventh scion died shortly after\nbirth, and so he was replaced with a\ndifferent child.
But then it turned out that the original\nprince actually survived, and he resurfaced\nafter all those years... Unbelievable!
Well, believe it. Or are you just repeating\nthe facts back to me to help it sink in?
I heard you well enough!\nI just didn't WANT to hear it!
Calm down. You're not yourself right now.
How am I to be calm about this?!\nBlasted Aurelius!
To do something that would pointlessly\ninvite chaos... What in the world was\nhis aim?! Such behavior ill suits a king!
But you can't just vent your anger as\nthough he has nothing to do with you,\nnow can you, Your Majesty?
Because you ARE Aurelius—King Aurelius\nof Alberia, come here from another world\noverwhelmingly like ours.
The world you hail from has a different\nhistory than the one we know. One that led\nnot to a brighter future, but to one of ruin.
And so the former king of Alberia leapt\nback in time, away from that ill end.\nSurely you remember your own journey.
I could never forget. It was all because of\nmy own foolish actions that the world was\nled to ruin.
And yet the man called Aurelius eclipses\nme in the sheer breadth of his crimes. No\ntransgression was beyond the pale for him.
Not only did he replace the seventh scion,\nbut he imprisoned the fifth scion for more\nthan ten years!
The idea that another man's foolishness\ncould outstrip even my own...\nUnfathomable.
I take that to mean you did not replace\nor imprison your children in your original\nworld, then.
...Beren died at a young age.\nI had not the time or need to cage him.\nAnd {player_name}...
He grew up healthy. At least,\nuntil about sixteen or seventeen.
When Beren died, I agonized over it.\nI told myself I would have done anything\nto prevent it.
Yet to replace a child like that... Could\nthis world's Aurelius not even imagine\nthe repercussions of such a deed?
Who can say? I am no more privy to\nhis reasoning at the time than you are.

I certainly didn't expect him to be this
different from myself. I had of course
understood that the Aurelius of this world
and I were different people, but...
I cannot fathom him at all.\nWas his entire way of thinking different\nfrom my own?
Or is what truly differs the world itself?
To be sure, your world and ours are\nfar from being one and the same.
Other worlds are axes of possibility.\nPlaces where one thing or another may\nor may not have ever come to be.
Small differences can produce great\nchanges, just as a small stone cast\ninto water can create large ripples.
In particular, there's no telling how things\nlike someone's personality can, with some\nimpetus, completely change.
This I cannot argue. I've come to feel\nthat it is a fruitless endeavor to speculate\nabout the Aurelius of this world.
In any event, to bed with him, quickly!
It could be infectious. We must endeavor\nto keep him isolated. And what's more...
He's burning up! You want me to go ask\nthe elder for some sylvan fever-reducer?!
No. Without knowing the cause, I can't well\ngo heedlessly administering medicine.
Then what do we do?\nI'm freakin' out here!
This is all quite the racket.\nWhat in the world is going on here?
Oh, Cassandra! Good timing. Do you\nhave much experience treating fevers?
Well, I know the basics...\nWhy do you ask?
{player_name} looked terribly\nflush and suddenly collapsed. We've yet\nto determine why.
The poor dear! For this to happen\nout of the blue is awful indeed.
A fever with an unknown cause?\nIt cannot be...
Let me see him and we'll go from there.\nWhere is he now?
Where was he when he collapsed?
What's that matter? Actually,\ncome to think of it, who are you?
An acquaintance of Cassandra's. More\nimportantly, was the prince at a royal\ngravesite when he lost consciousness?
How do you know that?\nWe haven't told anyone yet.
I knew it... Listen well to me.\nThis is no ordinary sickness.

It is the poison of a particular insect which
was supposed to have died off a hundred
years ago, but survived within the tomb.
And the cure is—
Ah, Cassandra. How is the prince?
He's fine now. Settled, thanks to you.
Did you know what happened because...?
Yes. The same thing occurred in my old\nworld.
Though that tomb is connected to the royal\nfamily, it's for a branch bloodline that\nhas by all accounts been totally forgotten.
In my old world, I was the one who told\nthe prince about its location.
That led to his feverish episode, and I\nregretted it. Of course, I explicitly did\nNOT tell him about it here...
Someone other than you must have.\nA brother or a sister? Or perhaps one\nof the royal guard?
How curious that the same event could\noccur in two worlds that have gone down\ndisparate branches in the flow of time.
The worlds must influence one another.\nEvents that occur in one are highly likely\nto occur in some form in another.

Then perhaps in regards to the children,
if I were placed in the same position as
Aurelius, would I have made the same
decisions?
Who can say? It's possible that the same\nthings would have happened due to\nelements beyond your control.
But it's like I said earlier:\nother worlds are axes of possibility.
The life of the Aurelius of this world\nwas one path you could have tread.\nOf that there is no doubt.
This has piqued my curiosity.\nMore than ever, I would know\nwhat Aurelius was thinking...
